description: The article "Align The Misaligned" discusses the fragmentation of the internet, comparing it to geological processes. It explores the concept of ecosystem architecture, which views digital landscapes as complex systems. The piece examines different types of fragmentation, their historical context, and the various perspectives on this phenomenon. It argues for embracing fragmentation as an opportunity for innovation and diversity, rather than viewing it as a problem to be solved.
excerpt: The internet has fragmented like tectonic shifts, mimicking physical space. Ecosystem architecture views digital landscapes as complex systems, embracing fragmentation for innovation. The article explores types of fragmentation, historical context, and perspectives on this phenomenon.
